div.head: George Goodrick Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen. The 26th of July anno Dominion
thousand six hundred seventie three I George Goodrick of Charles County
in the prov. of Maryland Gen. being sick and weake of bodie but of
sound and perfect memory praise be given to God and knowing the
uncertaintie
uncertantie of this life and being Desirous of setting things in order doe
make this my last will and testament in manner and form following that
is to say first and principally I commend my solute to God hoping that
by the merits of my saviour Jesus Christ I shall
my sins and my body to the earth from where it come to be buried in
such decent and Christian manner as my Executor shal think fit ans as
for my wordly Estate which God through his many hath let me my will
and meaning is the same shall be implayed and beloved as hereafter
by this my last will is expressed and first I will and require that all my
just debts be satisfied discharged and paid and I doe hereby unaumee
frustraite and make said all wills by me foremly made and declare this
to be my last will and testament.

Itm. f. I give and bequeath unto my two sonnes Robert and Francis Goodrick six
hunedred acres which I have by patent that is to say thee hundred to Robert
Goodrick and three hundred to Francis Goodrick next adjoining to the
plantation where they now live leyaline drawn equalie between them
and to them and their heirs forever which division may be made by the
bounds expressed in my said patent.

2 I doe give and to my Daughter Stapleford two years old
with adesine that my dear child unintelegable may have the
3 increase and other wares to be dispersed of I give and bequeath
to my daughter Guntryt on heifer more of the same age withthe same
intent and desire that my grnachild Francis Goodrick one cow with a cow
calf and the calf to be for my grand child Elizabeth Goodrick and the
increase forever.
